compression

Class HaarTransform

  • java.lang.Object
    • compression.HaarTransform

  • public class HaarTransform
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains methods for performing a Haar wavelet transform on an array of data and retrieving the original data from the transform. Some of the methods are particular to image data, and some are more general.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HaarTransform

        public HaarTransform()

    • Method Detail

      • sumTree

        public static int[] sumTree(byte[] data,
            int leafSize)
        Creates a binary sum tree whose depth is predetermined. It is assumed that the length of the data-array is 2^n for some n. LeafSize tells how many entries of the data-array is summed to be one leaf of the resulting tree.
        Parameters:
        leafSize - The size of leaves in the resulting array. Must be 2^n for some n=0,1,2,..,log_2(data.size).
        Returns:
        The tree with the leaves as first entries, their parents after it and so on, until the root is the last entry.

      • lossyTransformPowerOfTwo

        public static int[] lossyTransformPowerOfTwo(byte[] data,
                             int levelOfLoss)
        Performs a transform on an array whose length is some power of two.
        Parameters:
        data - The data to which the transform is performed on.
        levelOfLoss - How many levels of coefficients will be omitted in the transform.
        Returns:
        The transform.

      • lossyTransformArbitraryLength

        public static int[] lossyTransformArbitraryLength(byte[] data,
                                  int levelOfLoss)
        Performs a transform on the data array. The parameter levelOfLoss tells how much data is lost. If it's 0, the transform is lossless. For 1 the finest level of coefficients will be omitted, for 2 the second finest too etc. The data is split into subarrays whose lengths are powers of two and each of them has the maximum length that can be chosen of the remaining array- Then the method lossyTransformPowerOfTwo is applied to the subarrays. The results are given back glued together in the same order in one array.
        Parameters:
        data - The data to be transformed.
        levelOfLoss - How many levels of the coefficients will be omitted.
        Returns:
        The transform.

      • lossyTransfrom

        public static int[][][] lossyTransfrom(byte[][][] data,
                       int levelOfLoss)
        Performs a transform on a 3D data array. The parameter levelOfLoss tells how much data is lost. If it's 0, the transform is lossless. For 1 the finest level of coefficients will be omitted, for 2 the second finest too etc.
        Parameters:
        data - The data to be transformed.
        levelOfLoss - How many levels of the coefficients will be omitted.
        Returns:
        The transform.

      • addDivideConvert

        public static byte[] addDivideConvert(int[] data,
                      int addThis,
                      int divideByThis)
        An auxiliary method to calculate the inverses of a transform. Converts integers to bytes, but first adds addThis to each of them, and divides by divideByThis.
        Parameters:
        data - The integers to be manipulated.
        addThis - The constant that is added to the integers.
        divideByThis - The constant by which each integer is divided.
        Returns:
        The manipulated data.

      • inverseLossyPowerOfTwo

        public static byte[] inverseLossyPowerOfTwo(int[] transform,
                            int levelOfLoss)
        Retrieves the (approximate) original data of a lossy transform. It is assumed that the original data's length was a power of two (and consequently the tranform's length is also).
        Parameters:
        transform - The transform.
        levelOfLoss - How many levels of coefficients were lost in the transform.
        Returns:
        The (approximate) original data.

      • inverseLossyArbitraryLength

        public static byte[] inverseLossyArbitraryLength(int[] transform,
                                 int originalSize,
                                 int levelOfLoss)
        Retrieves the (approximate) original data of a lossy transform. It is assumed that the transform is of the form produced by the method lossyTransformArbitraryLength.
        Parameters:
        transform - The transform.
        levelOfLoss - How many levels of coefficients were lost in the transform.
        Returns:
        The (approximate) original data.

      • inverseLossyTransform

        public static byte[][][] inverseLossyTransform(int[][][] transform,
                               int originalHeight,
                               int levelOfLoss)
        Retrieves the (approximate) original data from a lossy transform. It is assumed that the transform is of the form produced by the method lossyTransform.
        Parameters:
        transform - The transform to be inverted.
        originalHeight - The height of the original picture, or more generally the length of the compressed line before the compression.
        levelOfLoss - How many levels of coefficients were lost in the transform.
        Returns:
        The (approximate) original data.

      • pow

        public static int pow(int theNumber,
      int power)
        An auxiliary method that raises an integer to the power of another. The power must be 0,1,2,...,21.
        Parameters:
        theNumber - The number whose power will be calculated
        power - The power to which theNumber will be raised, only values 0,1,...,21 are accepted.
        Returns:
        The result: theNumber^power.

      • joinArrays

        public static int[] joinArrays(int[] array1,
               int[] array2)
        An auxiliary method that joins two arrays together.
        Parameters:
        array1 - The first array to be joined.
        array2 - The second array to be joined.
        Returns:
        The two arrays joined as (array1, array2).

      • copyValuesTo

        public static void copyValuesTo(byte[] copyThese,
                byte[] copyHere,
                int startingIndex)
        An auxiliary method that copies an array of bytes into another array.
        Parameters:
        copyThese - The array whose values will be copied to the other one.
        copyHere - The array where they will be copied.
        startingIndex - The first index of the object array that is written on.

      • supPowerOfTwo

        public static int supPowerOfTwo(int n)
        Returns the greatest number that is a power of two and less than n.
        Parameters:
        n - A positive integer.
        Returns:
        sup{ 2^k : 2^k <= n}.
